title.narrative: Cameroun - Projet d’aménagement de la route Kumba-Mamfé

description.narrative: Les principaux bénéficiaires du projet sont les 1.384.286 habitants des trois départements de la région du sud-ouest du Cameroun mais également de façon indirecte, les populations des Etats situés dans la partie Est du Nigeria compte tenu du caractère régional du projet.

The direct beneficiaries of the project are the 1,384,286 inhabitants of the three divisions of the South West Region, while the people of Nigeria’s eastern States will benefit from the project indirectly, given its regional nature. The beneficiary population will contribute to the construction, management and maintenance of some related infrastructure.

L’objectif global du projet est de contribuer à la croissance économique du Cameroun par un renforcement quantitatif et qualitatif des infrastructures de transport du réseau routier national. L’objectif spécifique du projet est de contribuer au désenclavement et au développement de la région du Sud- Ouest du Cameroun par l’amélioration du niveau de service de la route entre Kumba et Mamfé et ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie des populations de cette région.

The overall goal of the project is to contribute to Cameroon’s economic growth through quantitative and qualitative enhancement of the transport infrastructure on the national road network. The specific objective is to help open up and develop the South West Region of Cameroon by improving the level of road service between Kumba and Mamfe and the living conditions of the people of this region.

Le présent projet vise à améliorer le niveau de service de la Route Nationale (RN8) entre Kumba et Mamfé. Cette route constitue un prolongement du corridor multinational Bamenda-Mamfé-Ekok-frontière du Nigeria en cours d’exécution sur financement de la Banque. Les travaux routiers prévus dans le cadre du projet portent sur un linéaire de route de 150,87 km. Le projet inclut également des activités connexes portant sur l’aménagement de pistes rurales, la réhabilitation d’infrastructures socio-économiques et la promotion de l’emploi des jeunes. La durée de la mise en œuvre du projet est de 5 ans et le coût total du projet est estimé à 108,45 millions d’UC.

The project seeks to improve the level of service of the Kumba-Mamfe Road (NR8), which is an extension of the multinational Bamenda-Mamfe-Ekok-Nigeria border Corridor under constructed with Bank financing. The project road works cover a linear distance of 150.87 km. The project also comprises related works concerning the development of rural roads, rehabilitation of socio-economic infrastructure, and promotion of youth employment. The project implementation will cover 5 years at a total cost estimated at UA 108.45 million.

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

receiver-org.narrative: GOUVERNEMENT DU CAMEROUN MINISTERE DE L'ECONOMIE ET DES FINANCES

title.narrative: Number of halfyearly work progress reports
Number of youths trained in labour-intensive skills (construction and public works)
People with improved access to transport
Per capita income level in the Project Implementation Area (PIA)
Number Rural Road Committees (RRCs) formed and equiped
Number of youths trained in entrepreneurship - of which women
Average travel time between Kumba and Mamfe
Number of functional axleload control stations
Number of functional traffic counting stations
Quarterly project implementation monitoring reports submitted

target.value: One (1) quarterly report prepared and transmitted throughout the implementation period

actual.value: 20 quarterly project implementation monitoring reports submitted

title.narrative: Number of youth economic interest groups formed and trained
People educated in road safety and HIV transmission
NGO and human association trained in the maintenance of Road/Transport facilities
Number of youths trained in labour-intensive skills (construction and public works) - of which women
People with improved access to transport - of which women
Number of youths trained in entrepreneurship
Jobs supported (Staff trained) - of which women
Average daily traffic on the South-West region road network
Related facilities, control and supervision of ancillary works

target.value: All ancillary works implemented 100%, including the related control and monitoring services

actual.value: As of 2020, the ten (10) ancillary contracts + the works control contract have been signed but their commencement remains suspended

target.value: In 2019, the accounting and financial audit report for the consecutive 2014-2019 project implementation years prepared and all the reports submitted and approved

actual.value: By 2020, audits conducted for the 5 consecutive years from 2014 to 2019 and reports submitted within the required deadlines

title.narrative: Monitoring and evaluation of impacts in the Project Area (PA)

target.value: Two (2) phases to be implemented representing 70%, including the pending second phase (30%) involving collecting and analysing socio-economic data in the PA

actual.value: First phase of services provided and report on the baseline situation transmitted and approved

title.narrative: Update of the Road Master Plan

target.value: The National Road Master Plan completed and approved from 2017

actual.value: The National Road Master Plan fully implemented and the report approved by 2020

title.narrative: Road safety audit during road works

target.value: Reports prepared and approved for each of the three (3) stages

actual.value: The consultant submitted the first inception report and the stage one audit report

title.narrative: Final control mission report on works available
